item.title: Why Facebook Knows You Better Than Your Friends Do
item.description:
A new study reveals that computers may be a better judge of character than any human ever could be.

The post Why Facebook Knows You Better Than Your Friends Do appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Issie Lapowsky

item.title: Chevy Could Beat Tesla to Building the First Mainstream Electric Car
item.description:
Chevy's working on a fully-electric car that will offer more than 200 miles of range for a base price around $30,000, due to arrive around 2017.

The post Chevy Could Beat Tesla to Building the First Mainstream Electric Car appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Alex Davies

item.title: Silk Road Defense Says Ulbricht Was Framed by the ‘Real’ Dread Pirate Roberts
item.description:
Defense attorney Joshua Dratel began trial with a surprising admission: that his client Ross Ulbricht was, in fact, the founder of the Silk Road, but was framed by his successor, the Dread Pirate Roberts.

The post Silk Road Defense Says Ulbricht Was Framed by the ‘Real’ Dread Pirate Roberts appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Andy Greenberg

item.title: Why on Earth Is IBM Still Making Mainframes?
item.description:
On Tuesday, IBM launched the z13 mainframe, which it bills as the first mainframe specifically designed to accommodate the booming mobile app economy.

The post Why on Earth Is IBM Still Making Mainframes? appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Davey Alba

item.title: Get Yours Today: Awesome Prints of Classic Nintendo Boss Fights
item.description:
These gorgeous art prints portray three classic Nintendo encounters in vivid detail.

The post Get Yours Today: Awesome Prints of Classic Nintendo Boss Fights appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Bryan Lufkin

item.title: Ash Plume from Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha’apai Strands Tourists
item.description:
The submarine eruption at Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai has become intense enough to disrupt flights in and out of Tonga.

The post Ash Plume from Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha’apai Strands Tourists appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Erik Klemetti

item.title: We Asked Psychiatrists to Analyze Gotham’s Unhinged Bad Guys
item.description:
Gotham is a batty city—particularly where its villains are concerned. From unhinged vigilantes to maniacal menaces, mental illness and criminality seem to go hand-in-hand in Batman's hometown. But are all these hoodlums actually suffering from mental illness? We asked some psychologists to analyse their bad behavior.

The post We Asked Psychiatrists to Analyze Gotham’s Unhinged Bad Guys appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Vasilis K. Pozios, M.D., Praveen R. Kambam, M.D., and H. Eric Bender, M.D.

item.title: Much Ado About Cord Cutting
item.description:
It’s impossible to miss the proliferation of screens in our society. Take a look around the next time you’re on public transit, at a café or on a plane: The vast majority of people you’ll see are surfing the web, tapping out an email, playing mobile games or watching Game of Thrones on tablets and […]

The post Much Ado About Cord Cutting appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Pampin, Cambium Networks

item.title: Not Just for Coders: Hackathons for Hardware Innovation
item.description:
I recently had a chance to participate in the MIT Media Lab’s “Make the Breast Pump Not Suck” Hackathon. Having observed my wife’s occasional pumping for our kids, I was in tune with some of the issues associated with pumping and was excited to work on improving these devices. I was also curious to return to […]

The post Not Just for Coders: Hackathons for Hardware Innovation appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: JD Albert, Bresslergroup

item.title: Publishers Are Lining Up Behind ‘Netflix for Books’ Services. But Why?
item.description:
On Tuesday, Scribd and Oyster both announced partnerships with Macmillan to bring new titles to their e-book subscription services. But how do all-you-can read platforms benefit publishers?

The post Publishers Are Lining Up Behind ‘Netflix for Books’ Services. But Why? appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Davey Alba

item.title: What’s Up With That: How Squinting Helps You See Better
item.description:
People often squint to try to see better. Why is that?

The post What’s Up With That: How Squinting Helps You See Better appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Nick Stockton

item.title: How Do You Model This Coin Flip Bet?
item.description:
If you flip a coin 100 times and win 20 dollars or lose 10, how much money would you win? Here is a numerical model of this game.

The post How Do You Model This Coin Flip Bet? appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Rhett Allain

item.title: Microsoft Turns to Verizon to Speed Up Its Video Delivery
item.description:
Microsoft is partnering with Verizon to speed up content delivery for its Azure customers.

The post Microsoft Turns to Verizon to Speed Up Its Video Delivery appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Robert McMillan

item.title: It Doesn’t Really Matter if ISIS Sympathizers Hacked Central Command’s Twitter
item.description:
For 40 minutes today, followers of the most feared terrorist organization in the world had free reign over a computer network of the US military. That is the story that many will take away from the hack of CENTCOM Twitter and YouTube accounts. And that story will be hyperbole.

The post It Doesn’t Really Matter if ISIS Sympathizers Hacked Central Command’s Twitter appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: P. W. Singer

item.title: Porsche Gives Us a Sexier, Faster 911 Targa—For a Price
item.description:
Just when you thought Porsche’s 911 Targa couldn’t get any better, along comes the Targa 4 GTS. The 911 Targa, unveiled a year ago with its seemingly magical pop-top, was the most beautiful open-top 911 since the original Targa appeared in 1967. But Porsche upped the ante yesterday at the Detroit auto show with 911 Targa […]

The post Porsche Gives Us a Sexier, Faster 911 Targa—For a Price appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Alex Davies

item.title: Some Idiot Will Probably Try to Trademark #JeSuisCharlie. It Won’t Work
item.description:
One of the side effects of social media has been a rise in various forms of online activism. We typically encounter it in the form of a phrase or slogan—often attached to a hashtag—used as a message to create awareness, share information and organize action around a particular cause or issue. As I write this, […]

The post Some Idiot Will Probably Try to Trademark #JeSuisCharlie. It Won’t Work appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Roberto Ledesma

item.title: Exclusive Titles Are Helping the Audiobook Business Boom
item.description:
A new story by a YA fave and an immersive audiobook from Matthew Modine show us how the already-surprising medium will continue to grow.

The post Exclusive Titles Are Helping the Audiobook Business Boom appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Devon Maloney

item.title: Cartographic Arts: Beautiful Maps From the Atlas of Design
item.description:
Many of the maps that go viral on the internet make professional mapmakers cringe due to terrible color schemes, landmass-distorting projections, and amateurish composition. You won’t find any of that nonsense here. The maps in this gallery were selected by a panel of cartographers and designers for the second volume of the Atlas of Design.

The post Cartographic Arts: Beautiful Maps From the Atlas of Design appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Greg Miller

item.title: New Documentary Follows YouTube’s Biggest Minecraft Superstars
item.description:
A new documentary, Minecraft: Into the Nether, will look at the lives of Minecraft streamers and Let's Players, and the fan events around the explosively successful game.

The post New Documentary Follows YouTube’s Biggest Minecraft Superstars appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Chris Kohler

item.title: What Michael Mann Did to Get the Hackers in Blackhat Right
item.description:
For his latest film, Blackhat, Michael Mann trains his lens on international hackers—and our growing fears of cybercrime. WIRED sat down with the 71-year-old writer-director at his LA office to find out how he manages to never go out of style.

The post What Michael Mann Did to Get the Hackers in Blackhat Right appeared first on WIRED.
item.dc:creator: Angela Watercutter
